The '''No Kings protests''' are a series of demonstrations that took place on October 18, 2025, largely in the United States, against [[Donald Trump]]'s policies and actions during his [[Second presidency of Donald Trump|second presidency]]. The demonstrations follow the [[No Kings protests]] held in June 2025.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Chibbaro Jr |first=Lou |date=2025-10-06 |title=Millions expected to turn out for anti-Trump 'No Kings' protests on Oct. 18 |url=https://www.washingtonblade.com/2025/10/06/no-kings-millions-expected-anti-trump-protest/,%20https://www.washingtonblade.com/2025/10/06/no-kings-millions-expected-anti-trump-protest/ |access-date=2025-10-07 |language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Dickinson |first=Tim |date=2025-09-08 |title=No Kings Unveils a Big New Trump Protest, and the Stakes Couldn't Be Higher |url=https://www.rollingstone.com/politics/politics-features/trump-no-kings-2-protest-october-ice-military-1235423204/ |access-date=2025-10-07 |website=Rolling Stone |language=en-US}}</ref> Activities are planned in approximately 2,500 locations, including at the National Mall in [[Washington, D.C.]]<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://time.com/7325683/no-kings-protests-oct-18/|title=Millions Expected to Attend 'No Kings' Protest on Oct. 18.|first=Nik|last=Popli|date=October 14, 2025|website=TIME}}</ref> A large turnout is expected.<ref>{{Cite news |last=Wise |first=Alana |date=2025-10-17 |title=No Kings organizers project a massive turnout for this weekend's protests |url=https://www.npr.org/2025/10/17/nx-s1-5576461/no-kings-protests-trump |access-date=2025-10-17 |work=NPR |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Santucci |first=Jeanine |title='No Kings' protest organizers aim to break these crowd records |url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2025/10/17/no-kings-protests-size/86728501007/ |access-date=2025-10-17 |website=USA TODAY |language=en-US}}</ref>

|url=https://www.fox5dc.com/news/speaker-johnson-claims-no-kings-march-planned-dc-hate-america-rally |access-date=2025-10-11 |website=FOX 5 DC |language=en-US}}</ref><ref name="The Hill Johnson Emmer Scalise">{{cite news |last=Fields |first=Ashleigh |date=October 14, 2025 |title=House GOP leader dubs upcoming 'No Kings' protest a 'Hate America' rally |url=https://thehill.com/homenews/state-watch/5554468-no-kings-protests-slammed-by-gop/ |access-date=October 18, 2025 |work=[[The Hill (newspaper)|The Hill]]}}</ref> while [[Party leaders of the United States House of Representatives#Party whips and assistant party leaders|House majority whip]] [[Tom Emmer]] said that the "terrorist wing" of the Democratic party was set to hold them.<ref>{{cite news |last=Wire |first=Sarah D. |date=October 16, 2025 |title=What to know about the Oct. 18 'No Kings' protests |url=https://usatoday.com/story/news/politics/2025/10/16/no-kings-protests-trump-what-to-know/86694507007/ |access-date=October 18, 2025 |work=[[USA Today]]}}</ref> Both called the protests a "Hate America" rally,<ref name="The Guardian">{{cite news |last=Leingang |first=Rachel |date=October 17, 2025 |title=US cities to resist Trump's crackdown on dissent with No Kings protests: 'We will not be bullied' |url=https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/oct/17/no-kings-protests-trump-dissent |access-date=October 18, 2025 |work=The Guardian}}</ref> backed by [[Party leaders of the United States House of Representatives#Majority leader|House majority leader]] [[Steve Scalise]].<ref name="The Hill Johnson Emmer Scalise" /> Separately, Johnson repeated the "hate America" label and added: "Let's see who shows up for that. I bet you see pro-Hamas supporters. I bet you see antifa types. I bet you see the Marxists in full display, the people who don't want to stand and defend the foundational truths of this republic."<ref>{{cite news |last1=Cunningham |first1=Tierra |last2=Oppenheim |first2=Oren |date=October 17, 2025 |title=What to know about nationwide 'No Kings' rallies set to protest Trump |url=https://abcnews.go.com/Politics/nationwide-kings-rallies-set-protest-trump/story?id=126611770 |access-date=October 18, 2025 |work=[[ABC News (United States)|ABC News]]}}</ref>

Duffy also accused No Kings of [[Paid protester|paid protesters]],<ref name="The Hill Duffy" /> as did senator [[Roger Marshall]], who baselessly [[George Soros conspiracy theories|put the blame on George Soros]], adding: "We'll have to get the National Guard out. Hopefully it will be peaceful. I doubt it." Senator [[Ted Cruz]] concurred and went further, urging to "cut off the money" behind "these rallies that may well turn into riots".<ref name="Chron Cruz">{{cite news |last=Bugenhagen |first=Faith |date=October 16, 2025 |title='Cut off the money': Ted Cruz targets funding behind 'No Kings' protests |url=https://www.chron.com/politics/article/no-kings-protests-ted-cruz-21103845.php |access-date=October 18, 2025 |work=[[Chron.com]]}}</ref> He spoke of legislation he had introduced that would allow use of the [[Racketeer Influenced and Corrupt Organizations Act|RICO Act]] to prosecute the money he alleged was behind No Kings for "supporting rioting and violence", and said he had urged [[United States Attorney General|attorney general]] [[Pam Bondi]] and [[Director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation|FBI director]] [[Kash Patel]] to prosecute.<ref name="Chron Cruz" />

Bondi said that "You're seeing people out there with thousands of signs that all match, pre-bought, pre-put together,"<ref name="The Guardian" /> which she attributed to antifa's high degree of organization,<ref>{{cite news |last=Sprayregen |first=Molly |date=October 15, 2025 |title=Pam Bondi said matching protest signs prove antifa is real. It didn't go well for her. |url=https://www.lgbtqnation.com/2025/10/pam-bondi-said-matching-signs-prove-is-real-it-didnt-go-well-for-her/ |access-date=October 18, 2025 |work=[[LGBTQ Nation]]}}</ref> and pledged to "get to the root of antifa" and "find and charge all of those people who are causing this chaos".<ref name="The Guardian" />

⚫
In Texas, governor [[Greg Abbott]] deployed the [[National Guard (United States)|National Guard]], the [[Texas Ranger Division]], state troopers and the [[Texas Department of Public Safety]] to Austin ahead of the rally, with the support of "aircraft and other tactical assets". He said in a statement that "violence and destruction will never be tolerated in Texas" and that he had directed "all necessary law enforcement officials and resources to ensure the safety of Austin residents". This prompted sharp Democratic criticism, with [[Texas House of Representatives]] Minority Leader [[Gene Wu]] denouncing the use of armed soldiers to suppress peaceful protests as the act of the kings and dictators, and Abbott as one of them.<ref>{{cite news |last=Svirnovskiy |first=Gregory |date=October 16, 2025 |title=Abbott to send National Guard to Austin for No Kings rally |url=https://www.politico.com/news/2025/10/16/greg-abbott-national-guard-no-kings-austin-00611802 |access-date=October 18, 2025 |work=[[Politico]]}}</ref>


⚫
Johnson and others characterized the protests as anti-American, or the "Hate America" rally.<ref name=":0">{{Cite web |last=Smith |first=Jillian |date=2025-10-10 |title=Speaker Johnson calls DC march planned by 'No Kings' group a 'Hate America' rally |url=https://www.fox5dc.com/news/speaker-johnson-claims-no-kings-march-planned-dc-hate-america-rally |access-date=2025-10-11 |website=FOX 5 DC |language=en-US}}</ref><ref name="The Hill Johnson Emmer Scalise">{{cite news |last=Fields |first=Ashleigh |date=October 14, 2025 |title=House GOP leader dubs upcoming 'No Kings' protest a 'Hate America' rally |url=https://thehill.com/homenews/state-watch/5554468-no-kings-protests-slammed-by-gop/ |access-date=October 18, 2025 |work=[[The Hill (newspaper)|The Hill]]}}</ref><ref name="The Guardian">{{cite news |last=Leingang |first=Rachel |date=October 17, 2025 |title=US cities to resist Trump's crackdown on dissent with No Kings protests: 'We will not be bullied' |url=https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/oct/17/no-kings-protests-trump-dissent |access-date=October 18, 2025 |work=The Guardian}}</ref> Some pundits circulated George Soros-related conspiracy theories and speculation about [[Paid protester|paid protesters]].<ref name="The Hill Duffy" /><ref name="Chron Cruz">{{cite news |last=Bugenhagen |first=Faith |date=October 16, 2025 |title='Cut off the money': Ted Cruz targets funding behind 'No Kings' protests |url=https://www.chron.com/politics/article/no-kings-protests-ted-cruz-21103845.php |access-date=October 18, 2025 |work=[[Chron.com]]}}</ref>
Some Republicans, especially in the South, attended No Kings events to arrange some counterprotests, chanting words such as "Trump is your president!"<ref>{{Cite web |date=2025-10-16 |title=The Resistance Reaches into Trump Country |url=https://ash.harvard.edu/resources/the-resistance-reaches-into-trump-country/ |access-date=2025-10-18 |website=Ash Center |language=en-US}}</ref>

==Background and organizers==
==Background and organizers==
The October 2025 protests follow the [[No Kings protests]] in June. Approximately 200 organizations have partnered for the October protests, including [[50501 movement|50501]] and [[Indivisible movement|Indivisible]] groups, as well as the [[American Civil Liberties Union]] (ACLU), the [[American Federation of Teachers]], Common Defense, the [[Human Rights Campaign]], the [[League of Conservation Voters]], [[MoveOn]], [[Public Citizen]], [[United We Dream]], and Working Families Power.<ref>{{Cite news |last=Leingang |first=Rachel |date=2025-10-17 |title=US cities to resist Trump’s crackdown on dissent with No Kings protests: ‘We will not be bullied’ |url=https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/oct/17/no-kings-protests-trump-dissent |access-date=2025-10-17 |work=The Guardian |language=en-GB |issn=0261-3077}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Wire |first=Sarah D. |title=‘No Kings’ protests could draw historic turnout in pushback against Trump, organizers say |url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/2025/10/15/no-kings-protests-trump-oct-18-turnout/86627101007/ |access-date=2025-10-17 |website=USA TODAY |language=en-US}}</ref> Organizers "have been adamant that the rallies remain peaceful",<ref>{{Cite web |last=Frank |first=BrieAnna J. |title='No Kings' organizers concerned about protests. == Republican accusations ==
In the days leading up to the October protests, [[United States Secretary of Transportation|United States Transportation Secretary]] [[Sean Duffy]] claimed that they are "part of [[Antifa (United States)|antifa]]."<ref name="The Hill Duffy">{{cite news |last=Suter |first=Tara |date=October 13, 2025 |title=Duffy claims ‘No Kings’ protests are ‘part of antifa’ |url=https://thehill.com/homenews/administration/5553477-duffy-claims-no-kings-protests-are-part-of-antifa/ |access-date=October 18, 2025 |work=[[The Hill (newspaper)|The Hill]]}}</ref> ''[[The Independent]]'' described antifa as [[Trumpism|MAGA]]'s "boogeyman" for the protests, and cited critics as warning that that the [[Second presidency of Donald Trump|Trump administration]] starting to define who is antifa - meaning, the administration maintaned, a terrorist on par with [[Islamic State|ISIS]]{{efn|''The Independent'' went on to note that Trump had labeled antifa a “[[Domestic terrorism|domestic terrorist]] organization” by [[executive order]], although the legal weight of the order remained unclear since there's no such designation under U.S. law and since, the newspaper described, antifa was a movement and not a specific organization, while [[United States Secretary of Homeland Security|Homeland Security Secretary]] [[Kristi Noem]] described it as as sophisticated and dangerous as [[MS-13]], [[Tren de Aragua]], [[Islamic State|ISIS]], [[Hezbollah]] and [[Hamas]] and seeking to destroy America.<ref name="The Independent antifa">{{cite news |last=Woodward |first=Alex |date=October 14, 2025 |title=MAGA-world already blaming ‘Antifa’ boogeyman for upcoming No Kings protests |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/us-politics/no-kings-protests-antifa-trump-national-guard-b2845229.html |work=[[The Independent]] |access-date=October 18, 2025}}</ref>}} - could mark a dangerous escalation of [[Targeting of political opponents and civil society under the second Trump administration|the targeting of the president's political enemies]], including Americans who march in protests the government has labeled as antifa.

The highest [[Republican Party (United States)|GOP]] political leaders said much the same, with [[Speaker of the United States House of Representatives|Speaker of the House]] [[Mike Johnson]] also linking the protests to antifa, saying "It’s all the pro-Hamas wing and the antifa people, they’re all coming out,"<ref name="The Hill Johnson Emmer Scalise">{{cite news |last=Fields |first=Ashleigh |date=October 14, 2025 |title=House GOP leader dubs upcoming ‘No Kings’ protest a ‘Hate America’ rally |url=https://thehill.com/homenews/state-watch/5554468-no-kings-protests-slammed-by-gop/ |access-date=October 18, 2025 |work=[[The Hill (newspaper)|The Hill]]}}</ref> while [[Party leaders of the United States House of Representatives#Party whips and assistant party leaders|House majority whip]] [[Tom Emmer]] said that the "terrorist wing" of the Democratic party was set to hold them.<ref>{{cite news |last=Wire |first=Sarah D. |date=October 16, 2025 |title=What to know about the Oct. 18 'No Kings' protests |url=https://usatoday.com/story/news/politics/2025/10/16/no-kings-protests-trump-what-to-know/86694507007/ |access-date=October 18, 2025 |work=[[USA Today]]}}</ref> Both called the protests a "Hate America" rally,<ref name="The Guardian">{{cite news |last=Leingang |first=Rachel |date=October 17, 2025 |title=US cities to resist Trump’s crackdown on dissent with No Kings protests: ‘We will not be bullied’ |url=https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/oct/17/no-kings-protests-trump-dissent |access-date=October 18, 2025 |work=The Guardian}}</ref> backed by [[Party leaders of the United States House of Representatives#Majority leader|House majority leader]] [[Steve Scalise]].<ref name="The Hill Johnson Emmer Scalise" /> Separately, Johnson repeated the "hate America" label and added: "Let's see who shows up for that. I bet you see pro-Hamas supporters. I bet you see antifa types. I bet you see the Marxists in full display, the people who don't want to stand and defend the foundational truths of this republic."<ref>{{cite news |last1=Cunningham |first1=Tierra |last2=Oppenheim |first2=Oren |date=October 17, 2025 |title=What to know about nationwide 'No Kings' rallies set to protest Trump |url=https://abcnews.go.com/Politics/nationwide-kings-rallies-set-protest-trump/story?id=126611770 |access-date=October 18, 2025 |work=[[ABC News (United States)|ABC News]]}}</ref>

Duffy also accused No Kings of [[Paid protester|paid protesters]]<ref name="The Hill Duffy" />, as did senator [[Roger Marshall]], who baselessly [[George Soros conspiracy theories|put the blame on George Soros]], adding "We’ll have to get the National Guard out. Hopefully it will be peaceful. I doubt it." Senator [[Ted Cruz]] concurred and went further, urging to "cut off the money" behind "these rallies that may well turn into riots."<ref name="Chron Cruz">{{cite news |last=Bugenhagen |first=Faith |date=October 16, 2025 |title='Cut off the money': Ted Cruz targets funding behind 'No Kings' protests |url=https://www.chron.com/politics/article/no-kings-protests-ted-cruz-21103845.php |access-date=October 18, 2025 |work=[[Chron.com]]}}</ref> He spoke of legislation he'd introduced that'd allow use of the [[Racketeer Influenced and Corrupt Organizations Act|RICO Act]] to prosecute the money he alleged was behind No Kings for "supporting rioting and violence", and said he'd urged [[United States Attorney General|attorney general]] [[Pam Bondi]] and [[Director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation|FBI director]] [[Kash Patel]] to prosecute.<ref name="Chron Cruz" />

It didn’t go well for her. |url=https://www.lgbtqnation.com/2025/10/pam-bondi-said-matching-signs-prove-is-real-it-didnt-go-well-for-her/ |access-date=October 18, 2025 |work=[[LGBTQ Nation]]}}</ref> and pledged to "get to the root of antifa" and "find and charge all of those people who are causing this chaos."<ref name="The Guardian" />

In Texas, governor [[Greg Abbott]] deployed the [[National Guard (United States)|National Guard]], the [[Texas Ranger Division]], state troopers and the [[Texas Department of Public Safety]] to Austin ahead of the rally, with the support of "aircraft and other tactical assets.” He said in a statement that "violence and destruction will never be tolerated in Texas" and that he'd directed "all necessary law enforcement officials and resources to ensure the safety of Austin residents." This prompted sharp Democratic criticism, with [[Texas House of Representatives]] Minority Leader [[Gene Wu]] denouncing the use of armed soldiers to suppress peaceful protests as the act of the kings and dictators, and Abbott as one of them.<ref>{{cite news |last=Svirnovskiy |first=Gregory |date=October 16, 2025 |title=Abbott to send National Guard to Austin for No Kings rally |url=https://www.politico.com/news/2025/10/16/greg-abbott-national-guard-no-kings-austin-00611802 |access-date=October 18, 2025 |work=[[Politico]]}}</ref>
